form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Menendez (for himself, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Schumer, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Booker, Mr. Heinrich, Mr. Sanders, and Ms. Warren) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make residents of Puerto Rico eligible for the earned income tax credit and to provide equitable treatment for residents of Puerto Rico with respect to the refundable portion of the child tax credit.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Earned Income Tax Credit and Child Tax Credit Equity for Puerto Rico Act of 2015.

section.header: Puerto Rico residents eligible for earned income tax credit

subsection.text: Section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: In the case of residents of Puerto Ricoâ€”

subparagraph.text: the United States shall be treated as including Puerto Rico for purposes of subsections (c)(1)(A)(ii)(I) and (c)(3)(C),
subsection (c)(1)(D) shall not apply to nonresident alien individuals who are residents of Puerto Rico, and
adjusted gross income and gross income shall be computed without regard to section 933 for purposes of subsections (a)(2)(B) and (c)(2)(A)(i).

paragraph.text: The credit allowed under this section by reason of this subsection for any taxable year shall not exceed the amount, determined under regulations or other guidance promulgated by the Secretary, that a similarly situated taxpayer would receive if residing in a State.

subsection.text: Subclause (II) of section 24(d)(1)(B)(ii) of such Code is amended by inserting before the period (determined without regard to section 32(n) in the case of residents of Puerto Rico).
The amendment made shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015.

section.header: Equitable treatment for residents of Puerto Rico with respect to the refundable portion of the child tax credit

subsection.text: Section 24(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting or section 933 after section 112.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015.
